s.text: Both the New York Times and Los Angeles Times headlines say that it's a U.N. force that's coming.
Hence today's newspaper deconstruction: "referred incompletely to the source" means "referred to the source, without mentioning that it was the source."
Hence today's newspaper deconstruction: "referred incompletely to the source" means "referred to the source, without mentioning that it was the source."

That figure was calculated by The Chronicle of Higher Education in its own story on the topic, but in the August 24 Times story, the $797 million appears unattributed in the second paragraph, and the Chronicle shows up in the fourteenth, and without being connected to the figure.
USA Today's headline notes U.S. support for the development but also the absence of American ground troops.
